qas.question: What portion of females reported that they were held back by managers?
In which year were these allegations raised?
After the 2003 incident, what was the next major year in which conerns were raised?
In which faculty were the methods used to fire people being questioned?
Who is the new President for Imperial College?
In what years did 1/2 the female axademics say bullying held back their carreer?
Who does Alice Ghast think will continue to struggle?
Who is the Vice President of Imperial?

plausible_answers.text: the methods that were being used to fire people

qas.question: What waw beeing question in the school of engeneering?

context: In <a1_0><b5_0>2003<b5_0/><a1_0/>, it was reported that <a0_0>one third<a0_0/> of female academics "believe that discrimination or bullying by managers has held back their careers". It was said then that "A spokesman for Imperial said the college was acting on the recommendations and had already made changes". Nevertheless, allegations of bullying have continued: in <a2_0>2007<a2_0/>, concerns were raised about <b8_0>the methods that were being used to fire people<b8_0/> in the <a3_0>Faculty of Medicine<a3_0/>. New President of Imperial College, <a4_0><b7_0>Alice Gast<b7_0/><a4_0/> says she sees bright lights in the horizon for <b6_0>female<b6_0/> careers at Imperial College London.
